byline.original: By ERIK ECKHOLM and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Mormon Church is debating whether to end its 100-year relationship with Boy Scouts of America after youth organization ended its ban on openly gay leaders; church's senior leaders are slated to address issue in August.
lead_paragraph: In August, the most senior leaders of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints are expected to discuss whether to end a 100-year relationship with the Boy Scouts of America over the end to a ban on openly gay leaders.

headline.main: Top Mormons Could Meet Soon About Leaving Scouts
headline.print_headline: Top Mormons Could Meet Soon About Leaving Scouts

snippet: In August, the most senior leaders of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints are expected to discuss whether to end a 100-year relationship with the Boy Scouts of America over the end to a ban on openly gay leaders.
